content: Calculate the average temperature of a list of temperature readings: [15, 20, 16, 19, 22]

To calculate the average temperature of the given list of readings [15, 20, 16, 19, 22], you sum up all the temperature values and then divide by the number of readings. Here's the calculation:

Sum of temperatures = 15 + 20 + 16 + 19 + 22 = 92

Number of readings = 5

Average temperature = Sum of temperatures / Number of readings = 92 / 5 = 18.4

So, the average temperature is 18.4 degrees.
